Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: NJDusty
Reviews.Content: I was in the area for a college lacrosse game, and was looking for somewhere to stay that was reasonably priced and close enough to the Inner Harbor that we could walk. I found this hotel be perfect. We could walk to the Inner Harbor and to Fells Point~which was so important to us since driving and parking in the city can be a hassle. Our room was clean and quiet...the beds were comfortable. The only thing that the room could have used was a small fridge. The staff was efficient and friendly. The parking valets especially were so helpful. Our room came with free breakfast, which consisted of the usual cereals, breads and waffles, and also Jimmy Dean breakfast sandwiches which really hit the spot. The staff in the breakfast area was constantly moving, whether cleaning vacated tables or re-stocking empty items. And everyone we encountered along the way was very friendly. There was a beautiful courtyard, a small (free) computer area, and a bar. All in all, a great stay. I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location... mediocre staff and room”
Reviews.Author: MrHao
Reviews.Content: I seem to have had a pretty different experience than other recent posters. Upon checking in, there was a single employee working reception. She was overwhelmed by the a big crowd from a tour group and other guests checking in, and her frustration was notable. One of the two elevators was misfunctioning, and guests were complaining, and were expected to climb flights of stairs with their luggage and belongings. Fortunately, were weren't in that tower. Our room was clean, modern, and well appointed. It was, however, quite small. The bed was very comfortable, tv and desk were clean and new. Shower, however, was lousy. Overhead rainshower style, which is good, if there's pressure. In this case, though, the water pressure was lousy, making for a bad experience. Internet was spotty, but free. Location is fantastic. Right in the heart of the inner harbor, very close to the waterfront, little italy, market place, etc. Price is right, though. Parking at $30/night seems like a utter ripoff, though the valets are very friendly and efficient. Checkout matched checkin. Took 15 minutes for some reason ( we were the only ones when we first started checking out).

Reviews.Title: “Also Loved It”
Reviews.Author: DeepFreeze63
Reviews.Content: Stayed there last night and had a great one night visit, My wife said that this had the nicest staff of any hotel we've stayed at. Property is clean, neat, cheerful, new, historic (Flag that flew over Fort Mchenry was made there), and convient to both Little Italy and the harbor. Room are spacious and bright. Beds are nice but not as great as those in the big ticket Marriotts. Nice exercise room (Tip - free ear buds at front desk). Over night parking is expensive ($30)!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: John P
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few weeks back, very nice modern property. Great complimentary breakfast and very comfortable beds! Everyone was so friendly, i would definitely return to this property.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: BlueMalibu
Reviews.Content: Three friends and I stayed at the Fairfield Inn & Suites Baltimore Downtown/Inner Harbor for one night. From the moment we arrived, until we left the next morning, the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and spacious, the bathroom was clean as well, and the beds were comfortable (though we didn't spend too much time in the room, as we came to Baltimore for a concert at the Ram's Head Live!, which was within walking distance to the hotel). They offer Valet Parking for $30 a night, which we decided to utilize because to park elsewhere was $18 a night, so for just $12 more, Valet was a better option because it was so much easier. We didn't make it to the continental breakfast, but upon checking out, we asked the valet where a good place to park was while we visited the National Aquarium (a brief walk from the hotel). He let us leave our vehicle at the hotel while we got lunch and went to the Aquarium, and provided us with complimentary bottles of water. There was also free Seattle's Best Coffee provided in the lobby as well. Also, the bar inside the hotel was great -- reasonably priced drinks and a friendly staff. I definitely recommend this hotel if you are traveling to Baltimore!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay! Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Pro Coach O
Reviews.Content: Stayed a night here at the Fairfield Inn @ Inner Harbor.... Nice stay... Quiet, very comfortable room... thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Kerry S
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel. When we arrived, we were promptly greeted by the valet worker who was very friendly. He had me go over the car to make sure that there weren't any scratches on the car and asked if we needed a luggage cart to our room. The only downside is that valet is $30 per day, but to me it was well worth it and I knew my car was being kept somewhere safe for being in a major city. The lobby was very well decorated, and we were greeted warmly by the front desk staff. He asked us the reason for our stay and I mentioned that we were there for a night out with a group of friends in the area. He even gave us free passes to a local bar at the Power Plant Live area. Our room was very clean and it still smelled like the cleaner when we walked in! The beds were also very comfy. There was a nice sized flat screen TV and the bathroom was also very clean and a deent size. We were attending a concert at Rams Head Live that night, and it was a 5-10 minute walk there, and it was also very safe. We left Rams Head around 2:00AM and walked back with a friend, but it was also very safe to walk back at that time of night as there were plenty of people walking about and it was well lit. We didn't have any problems with noise and slept nicely. The next morning I called down to valet for my car and it was brought to me within 15 minutes. The valet worker even provided us with cold bottled water for our ride home and gave me a map with directions on how to get out of the city safely. We were very pleased with our stay. One of the best hotels we've ever stayed in. We will definitely be back when we need to stay in Baltimore!

Reviews.Title: “superb location! very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Matthew M
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Baltimore for a weekend in October. I was with my GF and thought I would give this place a shot. Ive stayed in Baltimore a handful of times over the past few years and have stayed in numerous locations in the Inner Harbor. I thought this hotel was as good as any. The location is extremely convenient for everything. Your walking distance to Little Italy, and fells point. Your also not to far of a walk from the stadiums. The hotel was kept really nice. The rooms were extremely clean and modern. They also provide a complimentary continental breakfast in the morning which was fantastic. The only negative was the parking was a little bit pricey, and you can find cheaper parking if your willing to walk a few blocks from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Some amazing features and some problems”
Reviews.Author: cvilledewey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a week and our first impression was wonderful. Friendly staff, clean modern hotel, cozy tavern located off lobby, good breakfast. Tavern food was very inconsistent. Ordered the Rachel sandwich the first night and it was remarkable, but when I ordered it 4 nights later I had to throw it out. Great burger, awful chicken fingers. We loved our room with a separate living area - so comfortable that we actually looked forward to coming back to it each night. Desk help was also very inconsistent. Got some really good help and attention some days and incorrect advice and poor service on other days. In the end, we would stay again because at the end of the day, we really did enjoy walking into the warmly decorated modern hotel. This hotel has the potential to be a 5 star - especially considering it's location, but needs to train it's very polite staff to be more efficient, consistent and informed.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service.”
Reviews.Author: texanfan2002
Reviews.Content: We planned to hang out in the Power Plant area so this was a great location for us. Walking distance to Little Italy and we had a phenomenal dinner at Della Notte. Rooms were clean and was a very nice hotel. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “New Year's Eve”
Reviews.Author: LCXY
Reviews.Content: Good location for the activities at the harbor. Great fireworks. The hotel is located closer than it looks on the Tripadvisor map. It is at the corner of Lombard and President Sts. Close to restaurants in the Little Italy section. Took a while to get in a room. The first room they sent us to was not made up. The second room was non-existent, (479). Finally, was assigned a room we could get in. Everyone is helpful and wants to make sure your stay is pleasant. Many choices for breakfast. The first morning there was a long wait for the waffle machine but the next morning they had added a second one. Everything is kept very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Comfortable Beds”
Reviews.Author: Mandy R
Reviews.Content: This hotel had awesome service and they were extremely flexible. In addition, the beds were super comfortable and the breakfast wasn't too bad. The location was great and within walking distance to the Inner Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Good for proximity to Johns Hopkins + Taxi vouchers”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler654321
Reviews.Content: I spent a week here while a family member was at Johns Hopkins Hospital. Pros include: free taxi vouchers to/from hospital, new hotel, nice design for price range, clean rooms, can request quiet room facing a back street, tavern with decent food, free breakfast, rooms with microwave and fridges, can walk to little Italy and shopping. Cons: some desk staff don't know how to handle the vouchers, a Saturday night had only one person at front desk and it was a zoo, walls between some rooms are thin, the breakfast is pretty cheap-it could have been a step up for the price of rooms, parking is prohibitively expensive. Tip: leave your car at JHU hospital parking, get parking vouchers from hospital, and use hotel taxi vouchers to shuttle back and forth.

Reviews.Title: “Confortable, convenient!”
Reviews.Author: jrmiranda
Reviews.Content: First time choosing and staying on this Marriott related hotel. No complaints. Clean, excellent price. Nice appointed rooms, close to the Inner Harbor and Little Italy and Fells Point. Fun and friendly staff, everyone very helpful, nice Tavern with lite food. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has such a great vibe!”
Reviews.Author: CGINCG
Reviews.Content: We spent a few days at this super hotel 2 blocks away from the inner harbor and a 5-10 minute walk to Fells Point. Not only is the location super, but the hotel is extremely warm and cozy. The rooms are extremely clean, the staff extremely friendly, and our overall experience was great. The breakfast bar, while simple, offers waffles, breakfast sandwiches, fruits, juices, oatmeals, and some pastries - just as much as you'd really need. The interior courtyard is extremely peaceful and natural - and it really fits in with the hotel's environmental standards and certifications. One frustration was the slow elevators - unfortunately we were unable to find stairs to get to the second floor, so we were forced to wait a number of times.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Lesley S
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived until we left, the staff were all very helpful and friendly. The hotle room was spacious and comfortable, great value for money. Ideal for walking, within a few minutes of the harbour and other tourist sites. Onlyy downside in the room was that there was no safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: thunderfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed on a Saturday night towards the end of September using a free night I had earned with Marriott. Nice design elements in the public spaces reusing an older building. Great location since it’s situated between the Inner Harbor area and Little Italy (only about two blocks away). We had no complaints about our room, nice sized bathroom and a comfortable bed. The only problem we encountered was the room next to ours deciding to have a party around 3 AM. It took 2 visits from whomever the front desk dispatched to break up the party. But I guess that is a hazard you may run into in the Inner Harbor area on a Saturday night. The breakfast was typical of Fairfield Inn offerings (other reviews have offered details...no need to repeat their input). We would consider staying at the hotel again when the opportunity arises.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service and very expensive parking”
Reviews.Author: UniverseTraveler42
Reviews.Content: The hotel only has valet parking and it is $30 a day!!!! We asked about other options and they basically said there weren't any! We found that hard to believe, but it was late and we were exhausted. The rooms are compact, but the beds are comfortable and it was clean. Interesting showers where the water falls on your head. Kudos to the cleaning staff who are clearly the most capable employees (with the exception that I note below)! The only stair case was restricted to hotel staff. Given the need to get exercise, I found this appalling. But they only have one elevator in each tower so you have to use it to even get to the second floor (which we were not on) - which makes it a local every time, when it finally comes! Saturday night we went down to the hotel restaurant and bar to try to get some food because the event we were out tended to run out. It was around 10:45. We had a seat and watched some people getting appetizers, but no one came to serve us. We finally went up to the bar and were told that the kitchen was closed and no food was available! This a Saturday night near the inner harbor. It is my understanding that they have to serve food if they are serving liquor so this is probably illegal also. Sunday morning we were checking out and had to be at the event we were running early. I placed a wake up call that never happened! So the morning was very hectic. I went downstairs to get a luggage rack and there weren't any. When I asked if there were any and explained that I was late because they had not delivered the wake up call, they had the audacity to suggest I wait more while they look for a cart, and didn't even apologize for not placing the wake up call. I went back upstairs on their local elevator, we hung all of our stuff for the training on our bodies, and we waited for the elevator. People had ridden it up to be sure to get on so with us it was pretty full. We went down a floor and a staff member insisted on squeezing on with a huge cart full of towels. People were standing on top of my feet and each other to fit him on and he made us even later just to move his huge cart one floor. We got downstairs and fortunately they had retrieved our car, but they had backed it in so we had to stand on their spikey plants to load our car. Not sure if it was good for their plants but it was certainly not good for our suits. There was a taxi blocking us in, so I leaned on the horn for about 5 minutes making a HUGE racket and no one came. We had to leave so we somehow managed to maneuver out with only minor damage to our new car. This place was a night mare. I will never go back. If you want a comfortable bed and don't care about anything else or getting anywhere on time, its fine. Otherwise go someplace that cares about its guests.

Reviews.Title: “Fairfield Inn - Baltimore Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: CptCelt
Reviews.Content: Spent a great weekend at this Fairfield Inn only blocks from the Baltimore Inner Harbor. We travelled with our grandson and his parents and took 2 rooms. Both were clean, spacious and comfortable. The hotel is close to all Inner Harbor activities: shops, the aquarium, children's museum (which is now only open on weekends for the season), harbor tours, great restaurants, Raven's Stadium and Camden Yard baseball field. We would definitely return for future visits to Baltimore. It was a short drive to the Baltimore Zoo where we spent the better part of one day.

Reviews.Title: “Bright Room, Efficient Staff - Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Susan B
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights with 3 girlfriends on our annual "girl's trip." We were warmly greeted and permitted to check in 2 hours ahead of time. We were given maps and information about the area without having to ask. The room was bright, cheery, and clean - large enough for the 4 of us with 2 queen size beds that were very comfortable. The black and white bathroom was large and we did not have any problem with the shower. Staying on the 5th floor may have decreased some of the noise of the traffic on President Street but since I come from a large city the street noise did not bother me. They advertise that a continental breakfast is included but it is so much more. Belgian waffles, breakfast sandwiches, yogurt, fruit, cereal, bagels ++ . No reason to go hungry. The hotel is a "green" hotel and the staff is glad to tell you all about it along with it's history. It is conveniently located - only 3 blocks from the Inner Harbor and Aquarium and around the corner from Little Italy. Many people complain about the parking fee but if you come to a downtown area in a large city near the tourist attractions, I believe you have to expect to pay for parking. Space is limited. We paid $30 a day for valet parking but the hotel was much less expensive than any other that I found in the area and those hotels also charged for parking. We didn't leave the city until after check out time but the valet had our car at the door with all our luggage packed in the trunk. He made a map for me giving me directions to get back on the highway and sent us all home with a bottle of water. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and no parking”
Reviews.Author: JOANNE C
Reviews.Content: Checked in on a Saturday and was cheerfully asked if I wanted an upgrade. I don't recall going from a double to a "tiny" king room next to the noisy elevator an upgrade. Everytime I have been upgraded at Marriott it's been to a suite. The room was the smallest room i'd ever had at a Marriott. The people in the hall and elevator, traffic, sirens - the noise was all night long. There is no parking - you have to valet. I will continue to use the Marriott's on Aliceanna Street.

Reviews.Title: “Wet and not enough”
Reviews.Author: dennis m
Reviews.Content: First off there's no parking at the hotel, something not listed on line. So everything is valet. The hotel is very noisy. If you stay here stay on a high floor. Lots of traffic and sirens. Not a quiet hotel. The shower in the bathroom is a rain shower head. Like torture trying to get any water pressure. Moreover I checked into my room the carpet was wet. I told the front desk and was told the carpets had been cleaned and it would dry out. I asked them if they could put a fan on it so I am not sleeping in a damp room. "We'll look into it" was what I heard. Came back later that night, still damp. Woke up this morn and there's no coffee in the lobby. Its empty and the coffee station is filthy. And added to this it was 6:20 and no breakfast was ready. Supposed to be ready by 6am. I have one more day here (conference and everything else is booked). So far wet, late and not nearly enough attention to service. AVOID!

Reviews.Title: “Fresh, clean -- great value”
Reviews.Author: Hank44224
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at a Fairfield Inn and I'm a fan if the rest of their locations are as good as this. Everything in the hotel was fresh and looked newly redone. Decor in the room was lime and blue -- very bright, spotless. Staff was extremely help (as were all the people we met in Baltimore -- something in the water?) Breakfast was just right. Location was great -- walking distance of everything and the neighborhood felt safe. Use the Charm City Circulators -- free buses that loop around the city.

Reviews.Title: “great time!”
Reviews.Author: jimmymac131
Reviews.Content: Just came here for a mini moon with my new wife. Location was great we walked all over and where ever we ended up it was a cheap cab ride back . the only down fall was the temp in the room . Tried to turn it down but automactically went back to 72 . Was a pain until maintence guy took the sensor off for us .

Reviews.Title: “Fairfield Inn & Suites Baltimore Downtown/Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: docbutch
Reviews.Content: Fitted sheets! Yeah! New, clean, well appointed rooms. Friendly and helpful staff. Beautiful little courtyard. Breakfast although nothing available for gluten free folks (maybe some grits). Nice location and not that far from the Inner Harbor. Wish the additional Marriott points given to Elite patrons could be used for parking as valet was $30 plus tips. Parking garages nearby are just as much overnight. Street parking nearby non-existent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service price ratio”
Reviews.Author: Gupers
Reviews.Content: Perfect Location, close from the harbor and really good service.

Reviews.Title: “First Visit to Baltimore - JHU”
Reviews.Author: CentralFLBookLover
Reviews.Content: Room was nice, clean and attractive. As one who chooses not to drive in the city I opted to valet the car during our stay and either walk or taxi to destinations. Valet staff were very attentive and helpful. It would be nice to have a concierge on duty so the front desk staff do not have to field questions from travelers as well as handle check-ins. We did find that our cell phone reception was spotty at best in most areas of the hotel (AT&T). We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast. During our stay we taxied to Johns Hopkins University on a college tour with my daughter ($11 one way) and the adjacent Baltimore Museum of Art - which offers free admission. The Inner Harbor offers many, many restaurant options as well as boat tours within walking distance of the hotel. While the hotel's location on President Street is close to the Harbor I was not comfortable being out on the streets as the sun began to go down. Overall, very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “very nice. traveled with baby.”
Reviews.Author: Rican524
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a wedding across the street. I personally didn't see much green about it, but that's not why I was there. FYI breakfast closes at 10am. It wasn't fabulous but oh well. We had a 2 bed room and it was very large. We used their playpen and it worked out well. They also have laundry for $1 wash and $1 dry. However I didn't see detergent so keep that in mind. Parking can really add up, but be safe because someone had their car broken into ( she had her phone and GPS sitting in the seat for the world to see). If you are traveling in a group ask for your rooms to be close because we were placed in different towers of the hotel and had to use two elevators to get to the rest of our party. The computers/printers are free in the front lobby. We had appetizers and beer in the hotel bar at midnight. Every thing was extremely clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakfast, Good Room, Expensive Parking.”
Reviews.Author: Hambino85
Reviews.Content: I remember being a kid on vacation with my parents and I always measuring the quality of a hotel by how good its breakfast was. This place has everything a kid would want in the a.m. - mini muffins, personal size box cereal, jimmy dean microwave egg biscuit sandwiches, fresh fruit, and even two waffle makers where you can make your own waffles. Also, free coffee all day! The staff here are very friendly and get you anything you might need. The valet guys are nice, but at $30 per night, it's just too rich for my blood. Save yourself a little cash and park your car across the street in the BCC parking lot. Pretty sure that is where the valet guys take the car anyways. The hotel is about a 5-10min walk from the inner harbor and 15mins from the convention center - just make sure to know which direction you are going. Baltimore isn't the safest city and gets a bid shady just 4 or 5 blocks from the inner harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Great pick”
Reviews.Author: MHD4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when we came to Baltimore for a visit to Camden Yards to see the Red Sox play the Orioles. We were a little apprehensive about staying at a Fairfield Inn due to past experiences @ airport Fairfields. We were very pleased with this one! The room was spacious, bathroom as well. The beds were very comfortable. 2 queen beds was a plus for a family of four. At breakfast the next morning I was very impressed to see the manager ( her name escapes me) walking from table to table asking guests how their stay is and she was also helping to clear trash from guests tables. Our daughter has food allergies and she asked if she tried the candies that were by the elevator because they are allergy free. We had not had any yet because we did not know if she could. A few minutes later she came over with a small bag of candies as well as the ingredients labels for us to see. That is great customer service. We will absolutely return!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Reactor1966
Reviews.Content: Stopped in for a couple of nights on a business trip. I had stayed before at the Courtyard but it was not available this time. The Fairfield looked fairly far away on the map, but in reality it was a very short walk to the Courtyard (which happens to be very close to the client I was visiting). Actually, this location is a little bit better I think, because it gives you more options in terms of accessibility to restaurants. Very clean room, clean everywhere actually. Good breakfast included. Staff were very friendly and professional. In fact, after a very quick and painless check-in I came to realize that the girl who checked me in was on her first day on the job. They trained her well! I can't see spending another $100 to stay at the Marriott down the street.

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing staff of any hotel I've stayed at!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kristyroot
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went down for a long weekend at Inner Harbor for the Fourth of July. On check in we received a goodie bag that included free aquarium tickets. We had no idea and it made our welcome there even better! We thought we'd save some money and just park on the street. Woke up the next morning to our car being broken into and the window being smashed. Needless to say it put a damper on the start of our trip and we thought we would have to return home since the car was compromised. I went to ask the front desk about penalties about checking out early and they advised me to talk to the valet manager. I did and he was overly accommodating and offered to help us clean up the glass and park the car next to the front door for the rest of our stay. We were beyond words!!! They continually kept watch of the car until we could take it to get fixed on Tuesday. Point being, pay the price for valet...its worth it. The Assistant manager was also very helpful as well to help us figure out what to do on the Fourth since a lot of the museums we were planning on going to were closed. Very friendly and made us feel so welcome. She was wonderful. The rooms are amazing and modern, they have a great breakfast and the hotel is within easy walking distance to all the attractions. I could go on and on about how nice everyone was and how wonderful the hotel is, but you really must go and experience this yourself. There's a lot of choices for hotels that are priced higher in Inner Harbor, but NONE of them compare to the quality of this hotel. Simply amazing!!! We can't say enough good things!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful People”
Reviews.Author: JonesFamily009
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairfield Inner Harbor for the NCAA LAX finals. The people at the front desk went out of their way to be accommodating. When we returned after WINNING, the GM had put a basket of snacks in our room with a congratulations note!!!!! Can't ask for better customer service. Thanks and we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MassMoma
Reviews.Content: Booked this after I was unable to book the Homewood Suites which was my first choice. My family was pleased with the hotel. It is a short walk to the inner harbor and Little Italy so the location was great. Also within walking distance to the ballpark. We felt very safe and allowed our young teenager to walk around with a friend without us. Free breakfast with waffles, cereal, etc, which is always a nice plus. We would definately stay there again. They have nice patio area out back that was a great place to sit with friends and unwind.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: annettelessmann
Reviews.Content: My husband found this hotel for a good deal, and it far exceeded all of our expectations. It is in a fun area, close to Little Italy, and just a few blocks from the Inner Harbor. Everything we saw was accessible by walking. The hotel is newly renovated and was very luxurious for the price we paid. I also appreciated that the hotel is eco-conscious and recycled, had a "green building", and had eco sensitive toilets. We were impressed by the complimentary breakfast. Usually there is just cereal and milk, coffee, maybe pastries, and juice at a hotel. This one had a very extensive breakfast with many options. The hotel charges for valet parking, but we expect that in a big city. My husband found a parking spot on the street about 3 or 4 blocks from the hotel. Just be sure to check the signage around where you're parking. Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed this hotel and will return if we travel back to Baltimore!

Reviews.Title: “Parking is expensive as hell”
Reviews.Author: Viarchi
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and clean, location was perfect. Parking cost to much and thank god I am only here for two days.

Reviews.Title: “Simply fantastic! Our large family was accomodated beautifully while our loved one was in Johns Hopkins.”
Reviews.Author: ChristineM60750
Reviews.Content: We are a very large family from all over the country that needed a place to stay during a 2 week hospital stay at Johns Hopkins for our brother in law's serious illness. The Loft at the Fairfield Inn was an answer to our prayers! It was absolutely perfect for our family! It is immaculately clean with beautiful decor, new appliances in the full kitchen, two very large King and Queen/Queen bedrooms with 2 full bathrooms, a deck and a very large open living room and dining room with a huge table that can easily fit 16. We were very comfortable. It was quiet and has a very comfortable home like calming atmosphere. Breakfast including in the hotel in the morning was a huge help for our very hungry teenagers! Being less than a mile from the hospital in a great area close to the harbor, movie theater, grovery store, drug store and restaurants was great! The coordinator of our large group (Christie) was incredibly professional and attentive to our needs. The entire staff were very helpfu, accomodatingl and genuine. Thank you all so very much. We will recommend the Loft to anyone that we can and will stay again when/if needed! (Being a "greeen" hotel is really neat too!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service!”
Reviews.Author: oldcrow74
Reviews.Content: Our stay started out a little shaky as we found that the reservations had been fouled up. However, the staff in general, and the assistant manager in particular, couldn't have been nicer or done more to rectify the situation. Not only did we get upgraded rooms, but the assistant manager bent over backwards all weekend to make sure our stay was comfortable and enjoyable. We were traveling with two very elderly ladies who are very hard to please. The staff went above and beyond the call of duty to accommodate their demands. The rooms were clean, the food in the tavern was tasty and reasonably priced, and the valet parking was prompt and convenient. I can't say enough about the assistant manager. Whatever they are paying her, it isn't enough.

Reviews.Title: “Ice Cold Shower!”
Reviews.Author: vtbrooklyn
Reviews.Content: My check-in was a breeze and my room was nice and clean. Things were going well until it was time to shower the next morning. My shower was ice cold - I know waking up is hard to do sometimes... adding on an ice cold shower really makes the experience that much less enjoyable! I explained to the front desk staff what happened and was told that the hotel was fully booked and there just was not enough hot water to go around. If you cannot ensure things like hot water for all of your guests, then maybe you are overbooking the hotel? Really, I only expect a clean room, a comfortable bed and a hot shower. I don't think that is asking too much for a hotel. I'm a Marriott fan but I'll certainly never stay at this location again.

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: scfootball
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a nice stay at this place. Room was clean and very large. The hotel is very convenient to the inner harbor. It was also a very safe place and attitude of staff was ok. I would come back here to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DuffyDo
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Fairfield Inn and Suites over the weekend while in town for a Ravens game. We arrived very early on Saturday morning (10 AM-ish) and was able to check-in. The hotel is located near the Inner Harbor, Little Italy and Fell's Point. It's a smaller hotel but is very quiet and all the staff we spoke too were very pleasant and accomodating. Our room was clean and spacious. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service”
Reviews.Author: madreRochester
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Fairfield Inn on a stay in Baltimore. We checked in on a Sunday evening. Since we were taking a driving vacation, we had quite a bit of luggage. There is only valet parking and the valet was no where to be seen. After circling the hotel twice and waiting in the parking lot, we finally parked the car in the front and went in. The two people at the desk told us to go outside and wait. After about fifteen minutes, the valet showed up. We then had to struggle through the doors with all our luggage. The front desk people offered no help - not even to help us with the door. We had reserved a king room. When we got to our room we found we had two full size beds. My husband went back down and was told that his reservation had been changed. Since we did not change it, we were surprised that no one had let us know about the change. We were also supposed to have free parking but we were charged parking. We spent two nights at the hotel and the only pleasant employee we encountered was named Brittany - she removed the parking charges when we checked out. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The hotel is within walking distance of the Inner Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “5 "girls" from raleigh loved,loved,loved it!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GIRLSGETAWAY_10
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for our "girls getaway" since we arrived and departed by train. We were able to walk to almost everything we wanted to see. If not walking, the taxi and shuttle services were great! We would leave the hotel by ten am to do our sightseeing and shopping and by five pm, we were ready for the wonderful 101 Tavern, a glass of wine and the beautiful courtyard with the fire pit. That became our gathering place each day. Hotel was as "clean as a pin" and all of the hotel staff was so attractive and professional. May we mention Katy who helped us especially with museum and restaurant suggestions and Jackie at the 101 Tavern who provided our last lunch before we left for our train trip home. May we say that her menu had delicious choices which she created! We loved every minute of our stay with y'all!!!

Reviews.Title: “Goodness gracious!!!”
Reviews.Author: rohrmoser
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Very good location and was impressed that a Fairfield could be so cool. Everything is seemed to be new. One negative: $28 for parking.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was conveniently located, had great service and accomodations.”
Reviews.Author: LizaGundell
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairfield Inn with my nephews. The hotel was within walking distance of the Aquarium and the inner harbor. The rooms were comfortable and a good size. I found the staff to be very helpful. Having the complimentary breakfast was great with the kids, there was something for everyone and really helped to keep the cost down.

Reviews.Title: “Unique for a chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: barnhok
Reviews.Content: Our family of four really enjoyed this hotel. The property was not much to look at from the outside, but inside it wasquite attractive. Brick walls in the lobby were a bit dark but whimsical furnishings, flooring and art made the atmosphere fun and unique. As an eco-hotel, there's an emphasis on recycling, "green" products, etc, though I can't say that it was really evident during breakfast.The courtyard was very comfortable to use with an interesting water feature. There is no pool, and there's a tavern attached to the lobby, so it's a bit more "grown up" perhaps than some Fairfield Inns, but the location is perfect for families visiting the Inner Harbor, National Aquarium, Little Italy, etc... Valet parking was about $28/day but we parked on the street one block behind the hotel in an area where the residents had no garages and parked on the street. It seemed fairly safe and the car was fine. The desk staff was not super knowledgable but always tried to be helpful. I found it easier to use the internet to find direction, but the computers were conveniently only a few feet away from the front desk. There was also free wifi in the rooms. At check in, I was informed that due to fire code, no rollaway was possible with the 2Q room, despite having reserved this hotel on the Marriott website months earlier and indicating a desire for a rollaway. Since I have teens of different genders, we really have to have a 3rd bed. The clerk worked with me to find a solution, first offering me a different type of room at a much higher price and then, when I expressed my disappointment in the additional costs, looked to find a handicapped room with 2 Qs and asked if we would be okay with it. Turns out this room was huge and had plenty of room for a rollaway. We were very comfortable. There was some noise in the hall which we could hear in the room and at one point, someone was running around up a floor from us and it was fairly loud, but we didn't hear the folks next door. The breakfast was definitely a step below the Residence Inns we'd been staying at. There was cereal, yogurt, instant oatmeal, some refrigerated prepared fruit, small (but tasty) muffins, the ubiquitous make-your-own waffle maker, and pre=packaged, refrigerated breakfast items (one was allegedly a pig in a blanket on a stick, but looked like a corn dog and the other was an awful "quiche"). Also toast, juice, bananas, etc.. But the coffee was the best we had on our trip and made up for alot with us! Disposable everything--plates, cups, glasses, etc,. However, the room was clean and had lots of different seating options; again we found it very comfortable. The only facilities issue I had was that there was only one elevator and no staircase we could find to the lobby (it went outside). The hotel did feel really secure because of that but the waits at the elevator could get a little long. I would stay here again without hesitation. The price was right and it was super comfortable and convenient. While not upscale, it was modern and well furnished and just unique enough to really fit into to the renovated Inner Harbor/Little Italy neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff but not terribly clean.”
Reviews.Author: TUMaggieMay
Reviews.Content: We checked in and went up to our room and every seemed fine. The lobby smelled a bit funny, but the room seemed nice... until I went to take a shower. The shower had hair all over the walls and sides of the tub. It was pretty obvious that no one had taken the time to even peek in there, because I was able to get most of it down the drain just by rinsing it down. I did not have time to call to have the maid service come up to clean it and stil be ready for dinner in time so I made do, but it was pretty gross. Just going for one night I did not bring my own shampoo and conditioner. The bottles by the sink looked half used and had soap sud remenants on them. When we left for dinner and were waiting for the elevator we noticed that the carpets in the hallway were remarkably dirty as well. We returned back we went up and noticed the amount of noise that was present in the room. Staying in the heart of the city you will of course have noise, but it was as if the windows were open it was so loud. We went to sleep around midnight and were woken up at around 3 in the morning by a VERY loud group of people who kept us up on and off for about an hour. The walls are so thin you could hear someone blowing their nose next door, let along this group of screaming drunk people. Not the hotels fault, but the noise levels were crazy. Breakfast left much to be desired. I was shocked for a "green" hotel how many microwaves they had people use. Everything was frozen and you had to individually microwave your food if you wanted a hot breakfast. It didn't seem very environmentally sound... On an up note, every employee we encountered from the from desk staff, to the valets, to the bartender were wonderfully helpful and friendly. It was the best part of the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: LJ9804
Reviews.Content: Very reasonably priced. Stayed on a Monday night and got the rate of $199 which included valet parking and continental breakfast for a party of 4. The hotel was very modern and the rooms were spotless. The front desk staff and valets were courteous and helpful. The location was perfect -- just a few blocks from the Aquarium and Little Italy. Had an amazing meal at Miss Shirley's. The strawberry lemonade was the best I ever had and the sweet potato fries were yummy! I would definitely come back here again. Great value for the money!

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST REASONABLE & COMFORTABLE STAY EVERY”
Reviews.Author: blessed10_10
Reviews.Content: my huband & i stayed there for our honeymoon" the weekend was great, the breafast was fresh, hot,& on time after a night of parting with family & friends. the staff was very pleasent & respectable. I willbe returning each year in" March" . Looking for that sweet hospitelity that we recieved this year , also it's a "GO GREEN HOTEL". Come see for yourself you will be please .

Reviews.Title: “wont stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: quinnny
Reviews.Content: i went with my husband and mother in law july 4th weekend.. the staff was for the king bed suite so nice . we got there at 12pm and they let us check in three hours earlyl. great location. ten minute walk to the harbor five to little italy. i missed breakfast (slept late) the staff made up a plate for me despite my polite protests. valet service is pricey but vey hospitable- asked us if we needed any directions every time we got in the car. rooms clean. nothing fancy. we got the suite since mom in law with us. the only drawback was that i wish there was more of a seperation between the rooms. But will go again without her. cant beat the price. paid 150 on priceline fairfield 800 number wanted ten dollars more than priceline. overall a great place to stay for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Best for its location”
Reviews.Author: JLNairn0803
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for a weekend with 5 friends. While we were impressed by its location (less than 10 minutes to the inner harbor, less than 5 to Little Italy), the staff was less than impressive. They were really irritated by simple questions like "What time is breakfast over?". Breakfast was poorly staffed and chaotic. There was a lot of eye rolling and grumbling by throughout the check in/check out process. Parking was VERY expensive - $28 per night, and there was a tiny parking lot, so I would imagine that it could get filled up pretty quickly during peak seasons. We just parked at one of the garages across the street which was "only" $18 per night. The location was so great, that I would stay there again (and recommend it to others), but don't expect anyone to go out of their way for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: BostonKB
Reviews.Content: Location: The location of the hotel was very convenient for our purposes (about 15 mins to the airport, close to inner harbor, little italy and other points of interest). I was pleasantly surprised by how close the hotel was to the inner harbor, on the map it looked like a hike, but wasn't much more than a 5-10 minute walk. We also were able to walk back from the Fell's Point area (longer walk but scenic along the water). Rooms: The first room we were assigned, smelled very strongly of cigarette smoke (as in open the door and it hit you right away strong). Went straight back to the front desk and they were able to move us quickly, despite being at capacity that weekend. The room it self was small but serviceable (clean, simple decor). The "view" out our window was facing the courtyard and obscured by a giant metal tank, which made the room pretty dark even during the day. Overall, a fine place to sleep but not a place to hang out in all day. Service: The service at the front desk was friendly and helpful Hotel Restaurant: While we didn't eat here, the restaurant/bar was a good place to grab a drink (at reasonable prices, including specials in the afternoon) while waiting for the rest of our group to wander down from their rooms. Overall would stay there again when back in the Baltimore area.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: TXTravelcrazy
Reviews.Content: The location was great and within walking distance of my meeting. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Breakfast is included and was a good variety. I would definitely stay here again when in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient haven near Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: travelorkailuahi
Reviews.Content: Big, clean, comfortable rooms with great beds. Lot of choices for breakfast in lovely large great room. Wonderful, responsive staff. Laundryfacilities. Close walk to Inner Harbor. Next door to Betsy Ross' home where Star Spangled Banner was sewn.

Reviews.Title: “Baltimore Inner Harbor Fairfield Inn-March 2010 Trip”
Reviews.Author: go2asun
Reviews.Content: On April 1st I travelled to the Baltimore Inner Harbor with my husband and my 9 year old grandaughter. We stayed at the Fairfield Inn. It is located within walking distance of all the major attractions of the Inner Harbor. The hotel is new and the first green one in the area. The rooms are very nice and spacious and the staff is equally friendly and very accomodating. When we arrived we requested a mini fridge. Our room did not have one so they upgraded us to a 3 room suite. My granddaughter was thrilled to have an additional flat screen TV with living room area. It was simply lovely. They also had a complimentary wonderful continental breakfast in a lovely atrium setting. All the sites of the Inner Harbor such as the National Aquarium, Planetarium, Water Taxis to Fort McHenry and Fells Point, are nearby along with Little Italy restaurants right behind the hotel. The only drawback I can think of is we had to pay for parking and since we stayed the next day after we checked out we had to pay an additional fee. If that was the only issue i would rate this lodging very well and would definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlusts5
Reviews.Content: Fairfield Inn is well situated within two blocks of Inner Harbor and one block away from Little Italy. Speaking of which, walk the one block to Chiaperrellis for a great italian meal, terrific service, reasonable prices and wonderful atmosphere. The valet parking was reasonable, convenient and efficient. My only complaint was the elevator. Apparently there are two in the hotel but only one serves the towers. You can't take the stairs unless you want to set off the fire alarm. So if you are type A like me and hate to wait, beware.

Reviews.Title: “NICE NEW HOTEL - CLOSE TO EVERYTHING IN THE INNER HARBOR”
Reviews.Author: Popeye3161
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 days. Walking distance to Little Italy, the Inner Harbor, Fells Point. Nicely appointed rooms although there was quite alot of street noise at night. Very substantial free breakfast (even though the breakfast room could have been a little cleaner). Free wired internet access which can be very slow at times. Great Happy Hour in the Tavern 101 downstairs. Check on happy hour times to make sure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: purple8293
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fairfield Inn at the Inner Harbor in Baltimore as it was the least expensive decent hotel I could find. in a good location. I was a little leery, but was so pleasantly surprised. The hotel is a couple blocks from the Harbor, great location, able to walk to Little Italy and East Harbor also which was nice. The hotel looks a little more like a boutique hotel, but bigger. The lobby was nice: a little funky, dark colors. The room was clean, nice size, with a very large Flat screen tv, which we enjoyed. Breakfast was included, in a nicer than usual "great room". The staff were helpful and friendly, (they even found my lost glasses and told us that the restaurant "Rusty Scupper" had a shuttle and could pick us up for free" which was great!) Only negative is that you have to pay for valet parking, but that is true of every hotel around the inner harbor, due to lack of space. There is also another free shuttle, a block away on the Charm City Bus that can take you around parts of Baltimore. The orange line operates now, near the hotel, and they are adding other lines. Great location, great hotel, would definitely return. (no pool)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good rates, comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: beachmom77
Reviews.Content: Travelled with my husband and 2 children (ages 5 & 2 1/2). Hotel was short walk to inner harbor attractions, staff was friendly, free continental breakfast was great. No pool but great outdoor courtyard area. For the person that posted that there were only sheer drapes...not true. Behind the sheer drapes were the blackout curtains. Room wasn't oversized but clean and very comfortable. Price was just right for our family. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: chi-moo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night, the baltimore aquarium package. Check in was at 3pm but the hotel was able to work around our schedule and let us check in at 12noon. Staff was very friendly over the phone and in person. Valet parking was a bit steep, $28, but well worth it in the long run, valet is open 24hrs and staff was friendly. Room was a bit small but we didn't mind considering the room temp was controlled by a touch screen panel and the room had an HD/LCD flat screen tv, king bed was SO comfy, really great deal for this room considering we only paid $139 for the package. Wish we could have stayed longer than one night! Oh one more thing, Free Wireless Internet!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Accomodating”
Reviews.Author: HarveyBellmoreNY
Reviews.Content: My stay in Baltimore Harbor's Fairfield Inn and Suites was centered around an invitation to a reception a ballroom conveniently located across the street. The bed was very comfortable, the staff was very helpful, and the valet parking convenient (albeit $28). The only flaw was in the shower's water pressure which was adaquate at best. While heading home back to NY, I noticed that my prescription sunglasses were missing. I called the hotel, who, then, informed me that they found my sunglasses, then promptly mailed them to me. Futhermore, I had paid $28 in cash for valet parking. Upon checking the receipt the following day, I noticed that the valet charge had been paid on my credit card as well. I called the hotel to inform them of my double-payment and their erronious billing. They promised to get back to me after they check their receipts. They resolved this situation soon after by replenishing in my credit account the $28 in question. I was very happy with this hotel visit both during and after my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay for a quick trip”
Reviews.Author: VineyardKathy
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel for two nights for a family affair. It was absolutely spotless, comfortable, and convenient to the Inner Harbor. The staff could not have been more accommodating. The hotel was completely full but we were able to have their complimentary breakfast without issue. Parking was $27 per day but the AAA rate for the hotel was $94.00. We walked to the Inner Harbor and when we needed our car - we called down to the parking folks and it was ready for us in 10 minutes. After a tough day spent at a funeral, we were able to relax in the pub attached to the hotel for a glass of wine before bed. The hotel had a small but adequate exercise room but no pool. We did not use the outdoor patio because Baltimore had waist deep snow but the outdoor fireplace looked charming. A great place staffed with hard working people. Free wireless and printing!

Reviews.Title: “It was a horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Duffjm
Reviews.Content: How do I begin, our stay with our small kid was unexpectedly horrible. You would think that a Marriott would have better services. The staff, valet staff, and management were rude and offered poor customer services. There are only sheer drapes in the room, you cannot close the drapes fully to close out the busy lights of downtown inner harbor. The hotel did not offer a quite stay because of the windows let in LOUD traffic noise all night long. The television was a 52" HD but the picture quality was horrible. We asked the hotel staff to fix this issue and it was fixed for a couple of hours and then went back to the horrible quality picture. We frequently visit Mariotts and this was by far the worst Mariott we have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Great Price”
Reviews.Author: vinniemasch
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend getaway and found this hotel to be perfect. I am surprised this hotel is so reasonably priced; it's a steal as far as I'm concerned. Rooms were a bit on the small side but they were very modern looking and very clean. Hotel bar was great for late nights and free breakfast was better than your ordinary continental breakfast (bagels, yogurt, m-wave b-fast s-wiches, etc) and we found it to be more than adequate to start the day. No room service is only drawback. Hotel is only 3-4 block walk to Inner Harbor restaurants/shops and 2 block walk to Power Plant Live. We felt very safe walking even later at night. Parking is not ideal; valet is required. Staff was very nice as well. Did not take advantage of outside courtyard with gas firepit but looked very nice. Would absolutely stay here again; highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Star Spangled Stay”
Reviews.Author: NeedPivo
Reviews.Content: This is a new Marriott property located just east of Downtown and Inner Harbor in the historic Jonestown neighborhood, a history heavy section where few tourists venture. It also a short walk to Little Italy and Fells Point. (If it is history you seek, the Star Spangled Banner House, Shot Tower and Carroll Mansion are just steps away.) I am not sure if the building is original or converted from a previous structure (warehouse?), but it does offer up an atmosphere of coziness. There is a small lobby with the front desk, opposite from which is Tavern 101, where hungry tourists can feed on burgers or simply swill a brew. One thing to note: there are two buildings with separate elevators – something this reviewer discovered! The Fairfield does offer a nice lounge area, adjacent to the breakfast room, a 24-hour market, and an outdoor courtyard that features an ancient water tank converted into a fountain. As for the accommodations, my rooms, a King, was comfortable, ample, and colorful with a modernistic flair that offers a huge bed, ample closet and flat screen plasma television. The bathroom was average and provided all your basic toiletries along with a glass portioned shower with overhead nozzle, which was enough to wash away the grime from even the dirtiest guest. An enjoyable stay I say.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Hotel, just a few minor caveats”
Reviews.Author: WaterUnderBridge
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Here are our pros and cons: PROS: (1) This is a beautiful property! Location was excellent and very accessible to Johns Hopkins and the Inner Harbor. We valet parked the car when we arrived and walked the rest of the time, which was good for many reasons. (2) We reserved the eco friendly/Allergy Suite and it was beautiful -- spacious, two levels with 2 TVs and a bike to use if you should chose to ride through downtown Baltimore! (3) We were tired and cold and did not want to walk with our group to find someplace to eat for dinner -- we ended up eating at the hotel and we loved it! What more can we say? Stella Artois (and many others!) on draft!! The sliders were good, chicken fingers were yummy and the service was great (yeah to the staff member from Pennsylvania who knew about food allergies!!). On another note, the Jewish Deli down the street -- Attman's -- is not to be missed for lunch! (3) We loved the open courtyard area -- it was really just beautiful and tranquil to sit with an early morning coffee (which we did) or an evening drink (which we did) and look up at the city sky and just relax! It was a truly unique feature in a hotel that encompasses the history and beauty of the building (a restored brewery -- so beautifully re-done!) that the courtyard alone is worth staying at this hotel! (4) Rooms and main areas are sparkling clean. (5) Small but tidy and welcoming Market area had items available for sale in case you are craving a sweet treat or forgot something! (6) We did not care about the parking fee -- it is a city, they brought our car up SOO fast the next morning (thank you)! (7) We will be back!! (8) We liked the interactive map in the lobby with a touch screen and big graphics -- very cool! CONS: (1) In our suite, there is no door separating the sleeping area from the living area; however, there are stairs. As a result, there are 2 TVs very close together, not buffered by a wall and both TVs turn off and on (or mute) when you use the remote for one of the TVs. This "dual functionality" did not seem to effect changing the TV channel, but it was a tad annoying. (2) In the exercise room, there are TVs attached to the treadmills and one big TV on the wall. The TVs on the treadmills did not (a) work, on one of the treadmills; and (b) on the one that did work, the channel would not change from CBS/local. On the other hand, the very large wall TV (which is beautiful and very sleek) but only has a limited number of TV channels -- which was annoying and perplexing! Where were the local TV channels on this sleek/state of the art TV? The channels appear to start at 17 and go up but do not go lower than 17. In my opinion, the workout/exercise room was excellent, but the detracting and somewhat annoying electronics "issues" with the TVs were preeminent in my mind! (3) No salt and pepper available for the morning breakfast -- easy fix that they could make. (4) I cannot understand -- and none of us ever did -- how to work the heaters in the room. We were very cold at night, so be sure to check on the specifics before it is too late at night to ask (or when you are too tired to bother!). Again, great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: chjohnson
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my staff. Staff was wonderful. Parking was difficult but the hotel provided valet parking. Restaurant was fare for pub food. Noise outside of hotel during night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Stay overall with problematic areas”
Reviews.Author: Prettywoman08
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Baltimore on my way to our family Southern Vacation. This was one of the best stays I've had by far. The checkin process was bit rocky however as we had requested an early checkin. Upon arrival and speaking with the front desk clerk we were told that an early check in was doable and that we would only have to wait an hour. An hour turned into almost 3 hours having to wait for our rooms. We felt that the front desk staff person who assisted was not completely honest about the condition and timeliness of the room being ready. In addition, the other staff working at the desk were not friendly and did not present us with a warm and friendly greeting despite our effort to be the most curteous and nicest guests. The second thing that was a turnoff was the fact that there was no on-site parking but you had to pay $27 for validated parking.. bummer! I suppose that's not too bad for a Downtown Area. Last and not least was the breakfast area which was unimpressive at its best and the food was horrible! Overall, the rooms were fabulous, including the bathroom and the bedding, what can I say, one of the most comfortable nights rest I've ever had. In addition to the gorgeous room, I loved the location of where we were which was, you got it, Inner Harbor. I loved being within walking distance to restaurants, shops, harbor, and anything else you may have wanted to sight see. This was a very nice trip and despite the minor setbacks I would do it again. You will love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel...Good location, staff but two draw backs”
Reviews.Author: CidMan
Reviews.Content: Good location, friendly staff and comfortable surroundings make this a nice hotel. Check in, breakfast and facilites were great. Walked to Little Italy and the Inner Harbour. One major drawback was the shower. There was very little water pressure and the shower would barely rinse the soap out of your hair. Also, the $27/day valet was very steep given the hotel type.

Reviews.Title: “Brand New Sweet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lilemoevie
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very nicely decorated and in a decent location! Our room smelled fresh and NEW!! We walked to Camden Yards, about a 15 minute walk. The Aquarium is even closer, maybe 5-10 minute walk. It really wasn't too bad to get to Camden yards down Pratt since you can stop at the waterfront shops and there are plenty of places to eat between the hotel and the aquarium. Really liked the new shower, it had an overhead ceiling faucet, lots of pressure. Modern decorations and a giant tv. The bed was very cozy and I would definitely go back again! The parking was a bit expensive ($27), but it was valet and they did come back with the car pretty quickly. The front desk staff could do a better job of listening to their customers, they tended to interject with their co-workers conversations (went up to the desk 3 times and each time similar circumstance), there was a bit of chaos as a result.

HotelInfo.Name: Fairfield Inn & Suites Baltimore Downtown/Inner Harbor
HotelInfo.Address: 101 President Street, Baltimore, MD 21202
